data.text:
@georgehahn Second one done! #PfizerVaccine 
#crushcovid https://t.co/msd1IfHToC

@georgehahn I know many people who are not getting vaccinated because they have heard how awful the side effects are after shot No. 2. I personslly know many people, who have sailed through the second shot with no issues. Myself, and my two brothers included. Don't buy into the fear...

@_lisawoolf @georgehahn CONGRATS to your family.  if you need some further inspiration check out the Napa wineries we recommend https://t.co/JHeF0AYuuW and of course the award winning book that would make great gifts for guests!   https://t.co/afq3qJvI4k - cheers!!
@georgehahn Relief and fear off my shoulders.  This must be what my mother felt when I got the new polio vac so many years ago.

@georgehahn Thank you for asking George. I fell ill with Covid right before Halloween. Was sick almost all of November. Finally tested negative the Saturday after Thanksgiving. The vaccine? I don't want to be that sick again!! Still not quite over it. Long haulers. ❤#clubvax
@georgehahn Fully vaccinated! Besides arm soreness, no reaction from shots. Looking forward to spending Mother’s Day w/my vaccinated kids. #GetVaccinated
@georgehahn I had Moderna #2 a few days ago. My two weeks post-vaccine is Friday. Then party time!
@georgehahn #GetVaccinated https://t.co/d7FK7Wxv3n

@georgehahn As a healthcare worker, I was so excited to receive my Moderna vaccines! Also, menopausal. Hot flashes and masks just do not mix. 🔥 😷 I still wear a mask a work and will for quite some time. But now at least I can rip that puppy off without worry during a flash!
@carpenterjulie6 @georgehahn Intubated doesn’t compare to a sore arm. :)
@EJnPaysNonni @georgehahn I’m now able to go inside my son’s house to be with my granddaughter. The best.
@georgehahn That is wonderful! Just got home from taking my 17 year old to get their second dose. Husband gets his on Thursday. I got mine in March #GetVaccinated

@georgehahn Had covid March of last year; not hospitalized but so sick. Vaxed 2 months ago Moderna. Second shot was a bit rough but the next day I felt perfectly fine. And happy. Relieved. Whole family is vaxed and maybe now we can have Sunday dinners again
@georgehahn https://t.co/pUjL80F0zr
@georgehahn Got my second one today 💪💪💪💪
@georgehahn Videos? Do you have a YouTube or a podcast? I need more of you!

@georgehahn My daughter and I got our first dose of Pfizer last Thursday and are scheduled for round two on the 12th next month. So grateful to have been able to do this with her. https://t.co/7ScAwV9jhf

@georgehahn Fully vaxxed with Moderna. So far this week, I got to watch the Oscars at a friend’s & have dinner *indoors* at a restaurant with 3 family members. Thursday, a friend is having 8 ladies over for dinner. All of us have been vaccinated. I’m 67 & I haven’t done this in a year. 🙏💉
@georgehahn hi, had 2nd yesterday. My cat is keeping me company while i rest up.#GetVaccinated https://t.co/eReNok51Nt

@georgehahn I had panic attacks frequently years ago.  Got them under control.

Driving to my first shot, I had a massive one. Had to pull over on a 70mph highway. Deep breathed. Pressed on. Nurse wanted to calm me.
Me: "Just do it"

Going Thursday for #2, might freak again. 🤷‍♀️

I'm worth it

@georgehahn Whole family out here in California fully vaccinated - me, the husband, our son, our daughter, and the beautiful woman she is marrying in June! Napa Valley vineyard wedding wonderfulness here we come!
@georgehahn J&J - March 11, 2021. 47 days ago, no problems. #GetTheShot #GetVaccinated https://t.co/QDFhkhPWW8
@georgehahn https://t.co/xFlHPIkhUx

@georgehahn I’ve had both my Moderna shots. Sore arm a few days and a little tired the next day were my side effects. Nothing major at all. The shot didn’t hurt either and at 2 weeks post dose 2, I was visiting vaccinated friends maskless.

@georgehahn Got my first Pfizer April 1st, no side effects at all.
2nd on April 22, was expecting horrible fever, pain, lethargy etc., but got nothing!
Absolutely no side effects at all!
So relieved to be vaccinated, as a FT Lyft driver I’m at high risk of exposure to the virus
Get the shot! https://t.co/Hph5M7szCt
@georgehahn Second Moderna yesterday. Slightly achy and tired but very relieved.

@georgehahn 1st Pfizer vaccine in Feb. (4 months earlier than I expected) - no symptoms. 2nd shot resulted in 18 hours of feeling hit by a truck: extreme fatigue + insomnia/restlessness + chills + body aches.  If that’s half of what actual COVID feels like, I will get a booster each week.
@georgehahn Hi George. I got my second Pfizer dose yesterday with mild side effects. Feeling better now. https://t.co/zdVe2tI2O6
@georgehahn They took me behind a curtain.  Before you know it I was getting poked by two Johnson’s.  It hurt a little at first, but now I feel fabulous!

@georgehahn Hey George,
In Canada we can’t show our vaccinations at the site, but show thumbs up outside.
Me and my beautiful sister ...
🍷🍺🍺🇨🇦👍🏻 https://t.co/4TAgOYy181
@georgehahn Noon 1/20/21  It was a very good day. https://t.co/QinwxF1AP7
@georgehahn You are appreciated.
@georgehahn Got it! https://t.co/r8gEV2TBpe

@georgehahn I have pre-existing conditions, so I lined up as soon as I was able. I cried w/ relief at the 2d shot. One day of being tired & achy after that. 3 weeks post-2d shot now, & can't tell you how much more relaxed I am about living life, & can't wait to see friends & family soon!
@georgehahn I'm immune-suppressed due to medication for an IBD. Got my first shot three weeks ago (in Canada). Not even a sore arm. Looking forward to the second shot.
@georgehahn I got the Moderna vaccine.  My arm was sore after both shots for a couple days and mild bruising after the second dose, but zero side effects.  10/10 would recommend.
@georgehahn My first shot will be tomorrow 11:30 am eastern.
@georgehahn Got my 2nd vaccine today!  Let’s go - let’s live!!

@georgehahn I took the first opening I was offered. The combined energy of hundreds of people's relief and happiness had the entire place abuzz. 

It felt good to be part of something bigger than myself. 

Would do it again. 

Plus I got stickers. https://t.co/n1aw8Sttn5
@georgehahn Was nervous about getting it, due to my job, but talked it over with several medical providers. Second dose a month ago, still waiting for my third ear and discounted 5G.
@georgehahn Thanks for sharing this.  It's your wit and wisdom.

@georgehahn I got the J&J on March 5.  I tested positive yesterday for covid.  My symptoms haven’t been nearly as bad as they could have been.  Get your damn shot; this could have been a lot worse for me and I’m glad not to be in a ventilator right now.
@georgehahn 100% agree. I implored people on my FB page who were considering skipping #2 or not getting it at all, sharing my experience. Its temporary discomfort and the least we can do.

@georgehahn Both of my girls fully vaccinated. Whole family fully covered by May 1st. Not one of us suffered side effects. We are ready to travel and enjoy normal life again. #GetVaccinated https://t.co/LlmMEcbBOl
@Wissa38 @georgehahn Exactly! https://t.co/AUBKVbsHRe

@georgehahn I got my second dose of Pfizer a week ago yesterday. I feel great! Yes my arm was sore at the injection site, both times, and I did feel under the weather for a day after the second shot. I can’t imagine what I would have to go through if I caught the actual virus. #GetVaccinated

@georgehahn First done second one next week Wednesday🥳 and I'll STILL be wearing a mask. Did it for my mom she's immuno compromised.  Gotta make sure I keep her safe. 
#GetVaccinated

@georgehahn I took my 90 year old dad for his first shot in March.  He shoveled 6 inches of snow when he got home.  4 weeks later I took him for his 2nd shot.  We hiked for 2 hours through our local nature preserve immediately after rolling down his sleeve.  Real men get vaccinated.

@georgehahn Received my second Pfizer round yesterday afternoon with just a touch of fatigue so far.

Me in two weeks... https://t.co/LRilrH7tiL

@georgehahn Got 2nd Moderna last Thursday. Arm pain for a couple days, sleepy the day after, that was it. Counting down the days to “full vaccination” status. Just bought an extra charging cord for a new device to put in my travel pack-must mean I think I will fly again at some point!

@georgehahn I'm in WA, after getting my appt, it was the easiest thing! Everybody was so kind (and sanitized). Took less than 30 min. 

I have MS and take a myriad of meds. If I applied the same logic of not knowing what's in the covid vaccine to my meds, I'd be a rashy, blind, pain ball.
@georgehahn If you told me to eat dirt, I just might - so love your videos and comments - you say what we are all thinking.  We are better because of you.
@georgehahn 66 year old here 🇨🇦.  Got my first shot about a month ago. Aside from mild side effects…😂 https://t.co/wPYSXVswyv
@georgehahn No hesitation here.  In Canada we have limited supply.  As soon as I was eligible, I got my AZ shot.  Anything I can do to protect myself and others is well worth the side effects.
@georgehahn Only side effect I had both times was mild fatigue that lasted less than 24 hours 😁 https://t.co/hdMnejoY6S
@georgehahn 71 years old. Have gotten both Moderna. Felt a little feverish and achy after second  but only for three or four hours. Definitely feel relieved. Hubby had had both. No side effects.

@georgehahn Good morning, George. I didn't need to be convinced to get a vaccine, I was an RN for 40 years and remember the end of polio. Mine was Pfizer and at UT in Austin the process was easy. I had a little fatigue but no other issues.
Going out for pho this weekend.

@georgehahn Shot 1 and 2, no side effects

1/2021                         2/2021 https://t.co/wgQakHUy5T
@guitardeby @georgehahn That's awesome, and hope you get to have nice long hugs soon! If you have any pics/video when you were finally able to embrace, would love to share #COVID19
@BillyBy17 @georgehahn That's awesome, and hope you get to have nice long hugs soon! If you have any pics/video when you were finally able to embrace, would love to share #COVID19

@georgehahn I scheduled appointments for my in laws, my husband and myself back in March. We all have had our second dose. My 17 year old just received her second dose almost 2 weeks ago. My mother, my siblings and their spouses are fully vaccinated. My son is 15, so hopefully soon!
@anniepinkcheeks @georgehahn That's awesome, and hope you get to have nice long hugs soon! If you have any pics/video when you were finally able to embrace, would love to share #COVID19
@georgehahn Two weeks ago today we received our 2nd Moderna. So relived and grateful https://t.co/Ugkl2crmWb
@georgehahn I got my first dose on Saturday. It wiped me out for two days. Would I do it again? Yes! Feeling rough for a few days is preferable to the unknown of covid
@georgehahn Good job

@georgehahn Doing volunteer work for our Covid-19 task force in our HOA.  Worked the 1st day and was told that all volunteers would be receiving the vaccine.  Husband's appt was cancelled due to not enough vaccines.  Chatted with a person in charge, he got my husband.

@georgehahn Friends in the Philippines parents are in their 80's but their f***ing SDA church is telling them to NOT get the vaccine.

Fuck, I want to hate these evil institutions and individuals who want to float on cloud "science is shit and we always know better because..... "

@georgehahn Hubby and got our J&J vaccine on the 7th, the day it opened to everyone in NC. Look Ma, no blood clots! I want to hug people so please for the love of all that’s good listen to science and get your shots.

@georgehahn Had my 2nd vaccination yesterday (the vaccination programme is the one thing the UK Government has got right ) apart from a few aches and pains no side effects, enjoy watching your videos etc stay safe 🇬🇧
@georgehahn I don't know why you need a reason other than  "I don't want to kill my family, or anyone, by mistake"
